title: A 24-week, Open-label, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety and Tolerability of Rivastigmine Patch in Patients With Mild to Moderate Alzheimer's Disease (MMSE 10-23) Switched From Cholinesterase Inhibitors (Donepezil, Galantamine)
description_brief: This is a multicenter study to evaluate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of Rivastigmine patch in patients with mild to moderate Alzheimer's disease switched from Cholinesterase Inhibitors.
explanation_target: Reason: The intervention is rivastigmine delivered as a transdermal patch for patients with mild–moderate Alzheimer’s disease. Rivastigmine is a cholinesterase inhibitor that increases acetylcholine to improve cognitive function rather than directly modifying core AD pathology (amyloid or tau). citeturn0search3turn0search1

Act (key details extracted): • Drug: rivastigmine, transdermal patch (Exelon Patch). citeturn0search3 • Mechanism: cholinesterase inhibitor (inhibits acetylcholinesterase and butyrylcholinesterase) raising synaptic acetylcholine to produce symptomatic cognitive benefits. citeturn0search4turn0search7 • Clinical context: study explicitly switches patients from other cholinesterase inhibitors (donepezil, galantamine) to rivastigmine patch to evaluate efficacy, safety and tolerability. This is a symptomatic treatment strategy rather than a disease-modifying approach. citeturn0search5turn0search0

Reflect: Given the mechanism (cholinesterase inhibition) and clinical use ( symptomatic cognitive improvement in mild–moderate AD, including via transdermal formulation), the trial matches the 'Cognitive enhancer' category (drugs that improve cognition without targeting core AD pathology). Although rivastigmine is a small-molecule drug, its intended effect and mechanism align better with the 'Cognitive enhancer' definition than with 'Disease-targeted small molecule' (which is reserved for agents targeting AD pathology such as amyloid or tau). Relevant supporting sources: Novartis Exelon Patch product/indication page; Cochrane review summarizing ChEI effects; open-label/ switching studies showing use of rivastigmine patch after oral ChEIs. citeturn0search3turn0search1turn0search5
